com.meteorcode.pathway.io

Class FileHandle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.meteorcode.pathway.io.FileHandle
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClasspathFileHandle, DesktopFileHandle, JarFileHandle, RedirectFileHandle, ZipFileHandle

    public abstract class FileHandle
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstraction wrapping a file in the filesystem.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • virtualPath

        protected java.lang.String virtualPath()

      • manager

        protected ResourceManager manager()

      • exists

        public abstract boolean exists()
        Returns true if the file exists.

      • isDirectory

        public abstract boolean isDirectory()
        Returns true if this file is a directory.

        Note that this may return false if a directory exists but is empty. This is Not My Fault, it's java.util.File behaviour.

        Returns:
        true if this file is a directory, false otherwise

      • writable

        public abstract boolean writable()
        Returns true if this FileHandle represents something that can be written to

      • path

        public java.lang.String path()
        Returns the virtual path to this FileHandle.

        All paths are treated as into Unix-style paths for cross-platform purposes.

        Returns:
        the virtual path to the filesystem uobject wrapped by this FileHandle

      • physicalPath

        protected abstract java.lang.String physicalPath()
        Returns the physical path to the actual filesystem object represented by this FileHandle.

      • extension

        public java.lang.String extension()
        Returns:
        The filename extension of the object wrapped by this FileHandle, or emptystring if there is no extension.

      • name

        public java.lang.String name()
        Returns:
        the name of this object, without the filename extension and path.

      • file

        protected abstract java.io.File file()
        Returns the File backing this file handle.
        Returns:
        a File that represents this file handle, or null if this file is inside a Jar or Zip archive.

      • list

        public abstract java.util.List<FileHandle> list()
        Returns:
        a list containing FileHandles to the contents of FileHandle, or an empty list if this file is not a directory or does not have contents.

      • list

        public java.util.List<FileHandle> list(java.lang.String suffix)
        Parameters:
        suffix - the the specified suffix.
        Returns:
        a list containing FileHandles to the contents of this FileHandle with the specified suffix, or an an empty list if this file is not a directory or does not have contents.

      • read

        public abstract java.io.InputStream read()
        Returns:
        a InputStream for reading this file, or null if the file does not exist or is a directory.

      • read

        public java.io.BufferedInputStream read(java.lang.Integer bufferSize)
        Returns a buffered stream for reading this file as bytes.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file does not exist or is a directory.

      • readString

        public java.lang.String readString()
        Reads the entire file into a string using the platform's default charset.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file does not exist or is a directory.

      • readString

        public java.lang.String readString(java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
        Reads the entire file into a string using the specified charset.

      • write

        public abstract java.io.OutputStream write(boolean append)
        Returns an OutputStream for writing to this file.
        Parameters:
        append - If false, this file will be overwritten if it exists, otherwise it will be appended.
        Returns:
        an OutputStream for writing to this file, or null if this file is not writable.
        Throws:
        IOException - if something went wrong while opening the file.

      • write

        public java.io.BufferedOutputStream write(java.lang.Integer bufferSize,
                                 boolean append)
        Returns a BufferedOutputStream for writing to this file.
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - The size of the buffer
        append - If false, this file will be overwritten if it exists, otherwise it will be appended.
        Returns:
        a BufferedOutputStream for writing to this file, or null if this file is not writeable.

      • writeString

        public void writeString(java.lang.String string,
               boolean append)
        Writes the specified string to the file using the default charset.

        Throws an IOException if the FileHandle represents something that is not writeable; yes, I am aware that having some of these methods return null and others throw exceptions is Wrong and I should feel Bad, I wanted them to return an Option, but Max wouldn't let me.

        Parameters:
        string - the string to write to the file
        append - If false, this file will be overwritten if it exists, otherwise it will be appended.
        Throws:
        IOException - if this file is not writeable

      • writeString

        public void writeString(java.lang.String string,
               java.nio.charset.Charset charset,
               boolean append)
        Writes the specified string to the file using the specified charset.

        Throws an IOException if the FileHandle represents something that is not writeable; yes, I am aware that having some of these methods return null and others throw exceptions is Wrong and I should feel Bad, I wanted them to return an Option, but Max wouldn't let me.

        Parameters:
        string - the string to write to the file
        charset - the Charset to use while writing to the file
        append - If false, this file will be overwritten if it exists, otherwise it will be appended.
        Throws:
        IOException - if this file is not writeable

      • sibling

        public FileHandle sibling(java.lang.String siblingName)
        Returns a FileHandle into the a sibling of this file with the specified name
        Parameters:
        siblingName - the name of the sibling file to handle
        Returns:
        a FileHandle into the sibling of this file with the specified name

        public FileHandle parent()
        Return a FileHandle into the parent of this file.

        a FileHandle into the parent of this file.

      • length

        public abstract long length()
        Returns the length of this file in bytes, or 0 if this FileHandle is a directory or does not exist
        Returns:
        the length of the file in bytes, or 0 if this FileHandle is a directory or does not exist

      • delete

        public abstract boolean delete()
        Delete this file if it exists and is writable.
        Returns:
        true if this file was successfully deleted, false if it could not be deleted

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        Overriden equality method for FileHandles. Returns true if the other FileHandle is: 1. the same path as this Filehandle 2. the same subclass of FileHandle as this FileHandle
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        other - another object
        Returns:
        true if other is a FileHandle of the same class and path as this
